section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Account agreement" means one or more written instruments that establish when a certificate of deposit is payable.

"Certificate of deposit" means a deposit or share account at a depository institution that:
Is payable by the depository institution at the expiration of a specified time; and
May be transferable or nontransferable, negotiable or nonnegotiable, and renewable or nonrenewable.
"Depository institution" means a State-chartered or federally chartered financial institution located in the State that is authorized to maintain certificates of deposit.
"Maturity date" means the time specified in an account agreement when a certificate of deposit is first payable, without taking into account any agreement regarding renewals.

text.section:
Subject to subsection (c) of this section, an action to enforce the obligation of a depository institution to pay all or part of the balance of a certificate of deposit must be commenced by the earlier of:
The time that an action to enforce an obligation under § 3-118(e) of the Commercial Law Article must be commenced, if the certificate of deposit is subject to that section; or
6 years after the later of:
The maturity date of the certificate of deposit;
The due date of the certificate of deposit indicated in the depository institution's last written notice of renewal of the certificate of deposit, if any;
The date of the last written communication from the depository institution recognizing the depository institution's obligation to pay the certificate of deposit; or
The last day of the taxable year for which a person identified in the certificate of deposit last reported interest income earned on the certificate of deposit on a federal or State income tax return.

Notwithstanding subsection (b) of this section, an action to enforce the obligation of a depository institution to pay all or part of the balance of an automatically renewing certificate of deposit in existence on June 1, 2006, must be commenced by the later of:
6 years after the later of the events described in subsection (b)(2)(i) through (iv) of this section; or
1 year after June 1, 2006.
